workflow.name: Detect AWS Orphaned Resources & Send Cost Reports to Slack, Email, and Sheets
workflow.description:
## How it works

This workflow automatically scans AWS accounts for orphaned resources (unattached EBS volumes, old snapshots >90 days, unassociated Elastic IPs) that waste money. It calculates cost impact, validates compliance tags, and sends multi-channel alerts via Slack, Email, and Google Sheets audit logs.

**Key Features:**
- üîç Multi-region scanning with parallel execution
- üí∞ Monthly/annual cost calculation with risk scoring
- üìä Professional HTML reports with charts and tables
- üè∑Ô∏è Tag compliance validation (SOC2/ISO27001/HIPAA)
- ‚úÖ Conditional alerting (only alerts when resources found)
- üìà Google Sheets audit trail for trend analysis

**What gets detected:**
- Unattached EBS volumes ($0.10/GB/month waste)
- Snapshots older than 90 days ($0.05/GB/month)
- Unassociated Elastic IPs ($3.60/month each)

**Typical savings:** $50-10K/month depending on account size

## Set up steps

### Prerequisites

**AWS Configuration:**
1. Create IAM user `n8n-resource-scanner` with these permissions:
   - `ec2:DescribeVolumes`
   - `ec2:DescribeSnapshots`
   - `ec2:DescribeAddresses`
   - `ec2:DescribeInstances`
   - `lambda:InvokeFunction`
2. Deploy Lambda function `aws-orphaned-resource-scanner` (Node.js 18+)
3. Add EC2 read-only permissions to Lambda execution role
4. Generate AWS Access Key + Secret Key

**Lambda Function Code:** See sticky notes in workflow for complete implementation using `@aws-sdk/client-ec2`

**Credentials Required:**
- AWS IAM (Access Key + Secret)
- Slack (OAuth2 or Webhook)
- Gmail (OAuth2)
- Google Sheets (OAuth2)

### Configuration

1. **Initialize Config Node:** Update these settings:
   - `awsRegions`: Your AWS regions (default: us-east-1)
   - `emailRecipients`: FinOps team emails
   - `slackChannel`: Alert channel (e.g., #cloud-ops)
   - `requiredTags`: Compliance tags to validate
   - `snapshotAgeDays`: Age threshold (default: 90)

2. **Set Region Variables:** Choose regions to scan

3. **Lambda Function:** Deploy function with provided code (see workflow sticky notes)

4. **Google Sheet:** Create spreadsheet with headers:
   - Scan Date | Region | Resource Type | Resource ID | Monthly Cost | Compliance | etc.

5. **Credentials:** Connect all four credential types in n8n

6. **Schedule:** Enable "Weekly Scan Trigger" (default: Mondays 8 AM UTC)

### Testing

1. Click "Execute Workflow" to run manual test
2. Verify Lambda invokes successfully
3. Check Slack alert appears
4. Confirm email with HTML report received
5. Validate Google Sheets logging works

### Customization Options

- **Multi-region:** Add regions in "Initialize Config"
- **Alert thresholds:** Modify cost/age thresholds
- **Additional resource types:** Extend Lambda function
- **Custom tags:** Update required tags list
- **Schedule frequency:** Adjust cron trigger

## Use Cases

- **FinOps Teams:** Automated cloud waste detection and cost reporting
- **Cloud Operations:** Weekly compliance and governance audits
- **DevOps:** Resource cleanup automation and alerting
- **Security/Compliance:** Tag validation for SOC2/ISO27001/HIPAA
- **Executive Reporting:** Monthly cost optimization metrics

## Resources

- [AWS IAM Best Practices](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/best-practices.html)
- [Lambda Function Code](https://github.com/chadmcrowell/lambda-function-for-aws-orphaned-resource-scanner)

workflow.name: AWS Orphaned Resource Detector & Cost Optimizer

parameters.content:
## üö® AWS ORPHANED RESOURCES DETECTOR

**Use this n8n template to identify orphaned resources across all regions of your AWS account. This workflow helps you maintain inventory and control costs by detecting the most expensive waste in your environment, including unattached EBS volumes, old snapshots (>90 days), and unassociated Elastic IPs.**

### OUTPUTS
üí∞ Typical Savings: $50-10K/month
üìä Outputs: Slack + Email + Google Sheets
üîí Read-only, secure, compliant

### üöÄ QUICK START:
1. Configure "Initialize Config" node
2. Set region in "Set Region Variables"
3. Connect all credentials
4. Test: Click "Execute Workflow"
5. Verify: Check Slack/Email/Sheets
6. Enable: "Weekly Scan Trigger"

First run? ‚Üí See Prerequisites note
Issues? ‚Üí Check Troubleshooting note

parameters.jsCode:
const data = $input.first().json; // Helper function to format currency const formatCurrency = (amount) => `$${amount.toFixed(2)}`; // Helper function to determine status color const getStatusColor = (complianceRate) => { if (complianceRate >= 80) return '#10b981'; // Green if (complianceRate >= 50) return '#f59e0b'; // Orange return '#ef4444'; // Red }; // Build top expensive resources HTML const topExpensiveHTML = data.topExpensive.map((resource, index) => ` ${index + 1} ${resource.type} ${resource.id} ${resource.details} ${formatCurrency(resource.cost)}/mo `).join(''); // Build resource type breakdown const resourceTypeHTML = ` üì¶ Unattached EBS Volumes ${data.byType.volumes.count} ${formatCurrency(data.byType.volumes.monthlyCost)} üíæ Old Snapshots (>90 days) ${data.byType.snapshots.count} ${formatCurrency(data.byType.snapshots.monthlyCost)} üåê Unassociated Elastic IPs ${data.byType.elasticIPs.count} ${formatCurrency(data.byType.elasticIPs.monthlyCost)} `; // Build region breakdown const regionHTML = data.byRegion.map(region => ` ${region.region} ${region.count} ${formatCurrency(region.monthlyCost)} `).join(''); // Generate complete HTML report const htmlReport = ` AWS Orphaned Resources Report

üö® AWS Orphaned Resources Report

Generated on ${data.scanTime}

Total Resources Found
${data.summary.totalResourcesFound}
Orphaned resources detected
Monthly Waste
${formatCurrency(data.summary.monthlyCost)}
Per month
Annual Waste
${formatCurrency(data.summary.annualCost)}
Per year
Tag Compliance
${data.summary.complianceRate}%
${data.summary.resourcesWithMissingTags} missing tags

üí∞ Top 5 Most Expensive Resources

${topExpensiveHTML || ''}
# Type Resource ID Details Monthly Cost
No resources found

üìä Breakdown by Resource Type

${resourceTypeHTML}
Resource Type Count Monthly Cost

üåç Breakdown by Region

${regionHTML}
Region Count Monthly Cost

‚ö° Action Required: Review these orphaned resources and consider cleanup to reduce costs.

üìß This report was automatically generated by your n8n AWS Resource Scanner workflow.

`; return { json: { html: htmlReport, subject: `üö® AWS Orphaned Resources Alert - ${formatCurrency(data.summary.annualCost)}/year waste detected`, summary: data.summary } };

parameters.text:
=:warning: *AWS Orphaned Resource Alert* :warning:

*Summary for {{ $json.scanTime.split(' at ')[0] }}:*
- Total Resources: *{{ $json.summary.totalResourcesFound }}*
- Monthly Waste: *${{ $json.summary.monthlyCost }}*
- Annual Impact: *${{ $json.summary.annualCost }}*
- Compliance Rate: *{{ $json.summary.complianceRate }}%* {{ $json.summary.complianceRate < 50 ? ':x:' : $json.summary.complianceRate < 80 ? ':warning:' : ':white_check_mark:' }}

:fire: *Top Offenders by Risk:*
{{ $json.topExpensive.length > 0 ? $json.topExpensive.slice(0, 5).map((r, i) => `${i+1}. \`${r.id}\` | ${r.type} | $${r.cost}/mo | ${r.details}`).join('\n') : '_No resources found_' }}

:moneybag: *Breakdown by Type:*
- EBS Volumes: {{ $json.byType.volumes.count }} resources, ${{ $json.byType.volumes.monthlyCost }}/mo
- Snapshots: {{ $json.byType.snapshots.count }} resources, ${{ $json.byType.snapshots.monthlyCost }}/mo
- Elastic IPs: {{ $json.byType.elasticIPs.count }} resources, ${{ $json.byType.elasticIPs.monthlyCost }}/mo

:round_pushpin: *By Region:*
{{ $json.byRegion.map(r => `‚Ä¢ ${r.region}: ${r.count} resources, $${r.monthlyCost}/mo`).join('\n') }}

---
:point_right: <https://console.aws.amazon.com/ec2/home|View in AWS Console>
_Full HTML report will be emailed to FinOps team_

parameters.subject: =AWS Orphaned Resources Report - ${{ $('Calculate Summary Stats').item.json.summary.annualCost }}/year waste

parameters.text:
=‚úÖ *AWS Cloud Waste Scan Complete - Zero Waste Detected*

*Scan Date:* {{ $('Calculate Summary Stats').item.json.scanTime }}
*Region(s) Scanned:* {{ $('Set Region Variables').item.json.region }}

üéâ *Excellent news - no orphaned resources found!*

*What we checked:*
‚úì Unattached EBS volumes
‚úì Snapshots older than 90 days
‚úì Unassociated Elastic IPs

*Compliance Status:* 
‚úÖ All resources properly tagged
‚úÖ No cloud waste detected
‚úÖ Cost optimization maintained

üí∞ *Estimated monthly savings from past cleanups: Continue monitoring*

_Automated scan by n8n AWS Resource Scanner | Next scan: {{ $now.plus({ weeks: 1 }).format('MMM DD') }}_

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## ‚öôÔ∏è PREREQUISITES CHECKLIST:
### AWS:
‚òê IAM User: n8n-resource-scanner
‚òê Lambda: aws-orphaned-resource-scanner
‚òê Permissions: EC2 read + Lambda invoke

### n8n:
‚òê AWS IAM credentials
‚òê Slack OAuth/Webhook
‚òê Gmail OAuth
‚òê Google Sheets OAuth

### Setup:
‚òê Google Sheet with headers
‚òê Lambda function deployed
‚òê All credentials tested

## üîß CONFIGURATION:
### Required Tags:
- Environment
- Owner  
- CostCenter

### Settings:
- Snapshot Age: >90 days
- Regions: us-east-1 (add more in config)
- Schedule: Mondays 8 AM UTC
- Alerts: #cloud-ops Slack channel

Update in: "Initialize Config" node

## üÜò COMMON ISSUES:
### Lambda 403 Error:
‚Üí Check IAM policy includes :* wildcard

### No Email Received:
‚Üí Verify Gmail OAuth permissions

### Google Sheets Empty:
‚Üí Sheet name must match exactly

### Workflow Fails:
‚Üí Test each credential individually

### 1. Lambda Scans
Scan the AWS region for unattached EBS volumes, snapshots, and Elastic IPs using the Lambda script [here](https://github.com/chadmcrowell/lambda-function-for-aws-orphaned-resource-scanner)

### 2. Process Scans
Parse the Lambda responses from each resource type and calculate the cost while checking for missing tags.

### 3. Combine and Summarize
Combine volumes, snapshots, and Elastic IPs into a single array. Sums total montly/annual cost across all resources. Ranks top 5 most expensive resources. Outputs strucutres summary for alerts.

### Multi-Channel Alerts (Resources Found)

Parallel execution of three outputs:
- Slack: Immediate alert with top 5 offenders (~1 sec)
- Email: Professional HTML report with cost breakdown
- Google Sheets: Detailed audit log with all resource metadata

### Multi-Channel Alerts (No Resources Found)

Parallel execution of two outputs:
- Slack: "All Clear" confirmation message
- Google Sheets: Audit trail entry

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
